meanings.sent1: That shitheel stole my lunch money!
meanings.sent2: Don't trust that shitheel with your secrets.
meanings.sent3: The little shitheel thought he could get away with cheating on the test.
meanings.sent4: The politician proved to be a real shitheel, betraying the trust of his constituents.
meanings.sent5: The boss fired the shitheel for constantly showing up late to work.

meanings.definition: A person who is considered to be worthless or untrustworthy.
meanings.sent1: She knew he was a shitheel when he didn't keep his promise.
meanings.sent2: The town gossip was known as a shitheel for spreading lies.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the dog with a look that said, 'You're such a shitheel.'
meanings.sent4: The con artist turned out to be a real shitheel, scamming innocent people.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned the students to stay away from the shitheel who was caught stealing.
